newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent drifts down but off lows ahead of MYMEX.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent drifts down but off lows ahead of MYMEX.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures traded sideways to lower amid some light profit taking after Wednesday's late gains but short-covering ahead of the NYMEX opening on Thursday pulled the market back from the lows, brokers said.
"There is good support in place on the way down and it didn't get tested, it just drifted lower under no pressure, one broker said.
By 1334 GMT the August Brent contract was trading 18 cents lower at $18.74 a barrel after touching off a low of $18.66.
Strong support around $18.50 as long as it is held continues to maintain the market's bullish sentiment and analysts see sufficient technical momentum to push the market through $19 later today.
Gas oil futures drifted lower in a market that appeared to be running out of buying momentum.
The July contract stood $1 lower at $166.50 a tonne.

Analyst were less bullish for the market on the technical side with Wednesday's open and close at the same $167.50 level seen as an indication of uncertainty and indecision by buyers that will not maintain an uptrend.
However, they said the market was difficult to gauge at the moment with the narrow ranges unsurprising ahead of a holiday period though they said short term RSIs were well into the overbought region.
NYMEX crude and unleaded look poised to move higher again today with technical indicators looking very positive despite "high RSIs and toppy stochastics", analysts said.
"The trends are intact and the convergence of the five- and 15-day moving averages is very positive," said Charles Gray analyst at Prudential-Bache International Limited.
"Stochastics and RSIs although high are not signalling a turnaround," Gray added. He said "A move through $20.50 could spark a fast move to $20.85 a barrel".
